Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel with convex sides and rounded and everted rim, the fabric contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip, now worn away in many places, and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393956) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393956)
